item.title: Amanda Knox Acquitted of 2007 Murder by Italy’s Highest Court
item.description: The acquittal ended a long-running legal drama over the killing of a British student.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETTA POVOLEDO

item.title: At Least 9 Dead as Militants Attack Hotel in Somali Capital
item.description: Al-Shabab militants blasted their way into a Mogadishu hotel on Friday and took up positions inside, killing at least nine people and exchanging fire with security forces seeking to recapture the facility, a Somali police official said.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Houthi Forces Move on Southern Yemen, Raising Specter of Regional Ground War
item.description: On a second day of Saudi airstrikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen, Saudi and Egyptian officials declined to rule out the possibility of ground troops.
item.dc:creator: SAEED AL-BATATI and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Yemenis hoard ammunition boxes from army depots in the port city of Aden. Houthi-aligned forces advanced on the southern port town on Friday.

item.title: In Mexico, Firing of Carmen Aristegui Highlights Rising Pressures on News Media
item.description: Many believe Ms. Aristegui, a leading radio personality, and her team were fired after a report on a mansion built for the president’s wife by a company with lucrative government contracts.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETH MALKIN
item.media:description: Carmen Aristegui, a prominent radio journalist fired by MVS, waved to supporters after speaking with fellow journalists outside the radio station in Mexico City this month.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Karl E. Meyer and Shareen Blair Brysac on ‘The China Collectors’
item.description: The authors have written a rollicking account of the acquisition of Chinese art and antiquities by Americans who came to China in the 19th and 20th centuries.
item.category: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
The China Collectors: America's Century-Long Hunt for Asian Art Treasure (Book)
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ

item.title: Shiite Militias in Iraq Back Off Boycott Over U.S. Strikes on ISIS
item.description: A message of support from Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani, a religious leader in Iraq, apparently has the militias cooperating with the U.S. role.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ROD NORDLAND and OMAR AL-JAWOSHY

item.title: Israeli Center-Left Leader Seeks Path Forward
item.description: Isaac Herzog, who ran to unseat Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, does not see the campaign or its result in simple win-loss terms.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: A rotating campaign billboard in Tel Aviv showing Isaac Herzog, the leader of the Zionist Union, left, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, right.

item.title: Co-Pilot in Germanwings Crash Hid Mental Illness From Employer, Authorities Say
item.description: Among the items found at Andreas Lubitz’s home was one doctor’s note excusing him from work the day of the crash and another that had been torn up.
item.dc:creator: MELISSA EDDY, DAN BILEFSKY and NICOLA CLARK
item.media:description: Flowers at the monument in memory of the 150 victims of the Germanwings crash in Le Vernet, in the French Alps, on Friday.

item.title: Australia Warns of Terror Threat in Kenyan Capital
item.description: The alert from the Australian diplomatic branch in Kenya follows a similar advisory two days ago from the United States about neighboring Uganda.
item.dc:creator: ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH

item.title: France Seeks U.N. Security Council Resolution on Mideast Talks
item.description: Laurent Fabius, the French foreign minister, said France would consult with other Council members soon over a framework for negotiations.
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Turkish Parliament Expands Police Powers and Cracks Down on Demonstrations
item.description: Lawmakers passed a bill making it easier to detain people to uphold public order and giving the police more leeway to investigate.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU

item.title: Israel Releasing Impounded Palestinian Tax Revenue
item.description: The move by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was seen partly as indicating a desire to ease tensions, but also reflected advice from security aides.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: For G.O.P., Support for Israel Becomes New Litmus Test
item.description: Party members like James A. Baker III have learned that anything but unquestioning support for the Jewish state can mean trouble.
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER
item.media:description: Members of Congress greeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel in Washington this month.

item.title: Video: The Iran Nuclear Talks, and a Matter of Trust
item.description: A Yale student’s project tries to build relations with Iranians as negotiations over that country’s nuclear program reach a critical point.
item.dc:creator: EMILY B. HAGER

item.title: Cambodian War Tribunal Charges Another Ex-Member of Khmer Rouge
item.description: The 79-year-old suspect has been charged with “extermination, persecution on political and religious grounds and other inhumane acts.”
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Opinion: Messaging the Stars
item.description: Some say that broadcasting isn't a good idea when you don't know what's out there. But we needn't be so cautious.
item.dc:creator: SETH SHOSTAK

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Six Months Later, Small Protest Camp Grows Again in Hong Kong
item.description: The Occupy Central movement has been slowly expanding its presence in the Admiralty district as it approaches the six-month anniversary of the start of the mass pro-democracy demonstrations.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Tunisia’s Hour of Need
item.description: Bold action, by America in particular, could make a big difference in saving the country's young democracy.
item.dc:creator: MUSTAPHA TLILI

item.title: Stampede at Hindu Bathing Ritual in Bangladesh Kills at Least 10
item.description: The crush, which also injured dozens of pilgrims southeast of the capital, Dhaka, may have been set off by a rumor that a bridge was collapsing.
item.dc:creator: ELLEN BARRY and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK
item.media:description: Relatives mourned pilgrims who died on Friday in a stampede during an annual bathing ritual southeast of Dhaka, the Bangladeshi capital.

item.title: Chad Strongman Says Nigeria Is Absent in Fight Against Boko Haram
item.description: President Idriss Déby of Chad has won favor with the West, which is only too happy to call on his forces in a region seething with Islamist terrorists.
item.category: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
item.dc:creator: ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:description: President Idriss Déby of Chad, right, welcomed his French counterpart, François Hollande, last year in Ndjamena, the capital.
